text: The Dutch newspaper Brabants Dagblad said the boy was probably from Tilburg in the southern Netherlands and that he had been on safari in South Africa with his mother Trudy , 41, father Patrick, 40, and brother Enzo, 11.
Vagni, 62, was kidnapped along with fellow International Committee of the Red Cross-LRB-ICRC-RRB-workers Mary Jean Lacaba of the Philippines and Andreas Notter of Switzerland in January.
Graham, a Southern Tutchone tribal member from Canada, is charged with first- and second-degree murder and could be sent to prison for life if convicted.
